newsitem.title: UK: UK Conservative front-runner still backing Major.
newsitem.headline: UK Conservative front-runner still backing Major.

text.p: One of the favourites to take command of Britain's Conservative party after its crushing election defeat said on Friday he was still backing leader John Major.
"I will stand by him as long as he is leader of the Conservative party and so (will) a very large majority of the Conservative party," outgoing Welsh secretary William Hague told BBC television.

Hague, just 36, has long been tipped as a leading contender to take over the job of party chief but the scale of the government's defeat has sparked speculation that Major could resign sooner rather than later.
Hague declined to comment when asked whether he would put his hat in the ring, saying it was important that the party took a long considered look at the reasons for its defeat.
"We need some cool reflecion...not any decisions made in a hurry," he said, taking pains to stress his support for Major.
"I support him as leader of the Conservative party...I'm obviously in favour of him staying as leader of the Conservative party if he wishes to do so." -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7950
